page.title: 17HEATHCOTE SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: The{Heathcote Sewage Works,}after about fifteen years of operation is gradually coming to a close,for the Warwick works is taking over.At its peak it processed 7 million gallons of sewage daily;it now deals with about 150 000 gallons from Whitnash and Bishop's Tachbrook. Owned by the Severn and Trent Water Authority the site comprises 52 acres and in its present little used state (one sediment tank out of seven being used) it is a haven for several rabbit colonies. When sewage first enters the plant it goes into the{sediment tanks} for the removal of solid waste. Next it goes into{bacteria beds}where it is decayed;thence into{filtration tanks {and humous tanks}to be pumped,finally into sludge beds;water being returned to the system by way of a stream.
